simple.ml

Class Page

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.ml.Page
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Tag>

    public class Page
extends Object
implements Iterable<Tag>
    tag.tag.tag;number
    tag.tag.tag#attribute
    Do not add multiple roots of the same name! If you need to do so, make a dummy root node and add them there.
    Other dependencies: simple.CIString
    simple.util.do_array
    simple.util.logging.*
    simple.ml.Tag
    Created: Oct 16, 2010
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

      Finds a tag using it's fully qualified name.
      We have a document with this structure:
      html body p p The fully qualified name of the 2nd 'p' element is 'html.body.p;1'

    • Method Detail

      • addTag

        public void addTag(Tag tag,
          String where)
        Adds a tag to the page.
        Parameters:
        tag - Tag to be added.
        where - Qualified position to add the tag or null to add a new root tag.

      • getTag

        public Tag getTag(String where)
        Finds a tag using it's fully qualified name.
        We have a document with this structure:
        html
        body
        p
        p
        The fully qualified name of the 2nd 'p' element is 'html.body.p;1'
        Parameters:
        where - The fully qualified name of the element.
        Returns:
        The tag represented by where or null.

      • getTags

        public Vector<Tag> getTags(String name)
        Finds and returns all the tags with this name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the tags wanted.
        Returns:
        A Vector containing the tags.

      • rebuildCache

        public void rebuildCache()
        Rebuilds the tag cache. Should be called after a full parsing of the page

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Recreates an equivalent to the original page. This will not be an exact duplication.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        Source equivalent to the original.
        See Also:
        Object.toString()

        public String formattedSource()
